column4: I have an other question though. I'd also like to have access to windows from ubuntu, via virtualBox. The two questions are : "is windows slower and it is, how much slower" and "Do I need to leave an empty partition for windows or it will install somewhere like in /home"?
when you run VB, you create a disk file (.vdi) file
-- I run a VB Windows XP--only bad part is getting it synched with M$
